newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds slightly up, slim interest.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds slightly up, slim interest.

text.p: Argentine bonds were slightly higher late morning Friday as slim interest kept the market from making a break out of ranges ahead of Tuesday's policy-setting meeting of the U.S. Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC).
"There is a lack otrader at a foreign bank.

The trader said he thinks a 25-basis point hike in the U.S. Federal Funds rate is priced in but it is still very difficult to say how the market will react to any move considering that it will largely depend on the reaction of U.S. Treasuries.
Argentina's FRB Brady bond due 2005 was up 1/8 at 92-1/2, while the dollar-denominated Bocon Previsional 4 due 2002 was up $0.10 at 115.25.
Another trader said until the FOMC gives word on monetary policy "I see very light flows."
